author: vukedd
message: fix(curriculum): update answers for vs code lecture (#58682)

files.patch:
@@ -18,7 +18,7 @@ What does Visual Studio Code consider to be a "workspace"?
 
 ## --answers--
 
-The entire hard drive
+The entire hard drive.
 
 ### --feedback--
 
@@ -54,15 +54,15 @@ Why does the lecture recommend using a web server instead of opening an HTML fil
 
 ## --answers--
 
-It's faster to load.
+It's faster to load and makes it easier to spot issues in your codebase.
 
 ### --feedback--
 
 The lecture mentions a specific issue that can occur when opening HTML files directly.
 
 ---
 
-It provides better security.
+It provides better security for large software applications.
 
 ### --feedback--
 
@@ -74,7 +74,7 @@ It avoids unexpected bugs, such as CSS not loading properly.
 
 ---
 
-It allows for real-time collaboration.
+It allows for real-time collaboration with other developers on a team.
 
 ### --feedback--
